title.narrative: To provide cash & livelihood support to Covid & Cyclone affected communities in West Bengal

description.narrative: North & South 24 Paraganas districts of West Bengal lying in the flood prone zones was affected by massive floods in the month of October 2021 and thus displaced 22 lakh people and caused destructions. People of these districts are dealing with Covid and flood related challenges together. Access to social welfare schemes are low in these districts in comparison to other States due to political conflict. People have been pushed into poverty due to loss of livelihoods. Partner to conduct baseline assessment and identify 260 households of covid impacted, migrants, single women headed, daily wage workers and disabled person and support them with cash transfer 4500/- per household. Apart from that 70 HH within this 260 HH would be selected to received conditional livelihood support of INR 3500/- to take up selective livelihood options decided on interaction with community/.

The flood affected communities to receive cash transfer of 4500/- to take care of their immediate needs and conditional cash transfer of 3500/- to support in choosing alternate livelihood options. The community comprises of people depending on daily wage work of carpentry, plumping and agriculture etc. Flood also caused huge destruction to houses and money can also been given for repairing of shelters etc. Along with the base line assessment partner would also take up community accountability assessment (CAA) to know the most trusted channels for receiving information or sharing feedbacks from CA/CAPL/CNISBSS. To inform violence against women, fraud or bad behaviour of staff CAPL dedicated safeguarding lines also to be shared with the community.
